intro: Mariscus maderaspatanus, commonly known as the Maderaspatan mariscus, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery leaves. The plant thrives in shaded, humid environments, typically found in dense forests at high altitudes. Its conservation status is critical due to habitat loss and over-collection for ornamental purposes. Mariscus maderaspatanus plays a vital role in its ecosystem, supporting various insect and bird species.
